channel.title: NODE on 函数计算
channel.description: Recent content in NODE on 函数计算

item.title: Gatsby Notes
item.description: bind eip gatsby develop -- --host=0.0.0.0 Prettier VS Code plugin JSX The hybrid “HTML-in-JS” is actually a syntax extension of JavaScript, for React, called JSX In pure JavaScript, it looks more like this: src/pages/index.js import React from "react" export default () => React.createElement("div", null, "Hello world!") Now you can spot the use of the ‘react’ import! But wait. You’re writing JSX, not pure HTML and JavaScript. How does the browser read that?

item.title: Nodejs Notes
item.description: set registry npm config set registry=http://registry.npm.taobao.org npm config ls -l userconfig = "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.npmrc"
